resources.string:
Use BookWorm to keep track of books you have read, and you intend to read. Maintain a log of books that you can quickly view, sort, filter, and rate.

For more information, and to comment or report issues, please visit the BookWorm project site.

Whoops, that entry didn't work. The product code/ISBN result was %s. Please try again, or use a different entry method. (If you are having trouble scanning a book, check out Menu->Scanning Tips.)
Book data source not found, internal error, or networking issue.

*If the scanner works but recognizes a product rather than a book, try looking for a different bar code. Books often have multiple codes. The inside front cover may have another code that is different from the back. Especially for older paperback books, the inside cover code works more reliably.

*Make sure you are not scanning a sticker that has been placed over the bar code by a retailer. Many retailers do this, and the proprietary retailer codes will not scan.

*Some books just do not scan. Product codes that cannot be interpreted as ISBNs will not work. In those cases try a web search for the title. It's still pretty quick, and it will likely work.
